arm_group.description: patients treated with placebo for at least 4 months before IVF attempt
patients treated with danazol (100mg/day)for at least 4 months before IVF attempt

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether pre-treatment with danazol for at least 4
      months before controlled ovarian hyperstimulation for IVF cycles improves pregnancy rate.

clinical_study.brief_title: Danazol Treatment in Endometriosis Women Before IVF

detailed_description.textblock:
Endometriosis is a chronic benign disease defined by the presence of endometrial tissue
      outside the uterine cavity, affecting women in their reproductive age. This disease is
      clinically characterized by infertility pelvic pain and the presence of ovarian cysts,
      endometriomas, and affects the about 10% of women. Women with endometriosis when undergo IVF
      show lower pregnancy rate than general population, and a reduced ovarian reserve, due to the
      diseases and often to ovarian surgery. The aim of this study is to evaluate if a
      pre-treatment with danazol, an anti-estrogenic agent, may improve the otcome of IVF cycles
      in these women

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        - Clinical diagnosis of endometriosis previous laparoscopic surgery for ovarian
        endometriotic cysts infertility

        Exclusion Criteria:

        - age more than 40 years systemic disease antimulleran hormone (AMH)<1 and FSH>20

intervention.description: 100 mg day for 4 monthh in women with diagnosed endometriosis before IVF
administered daily like the active comparator

clinical_study.official_title: Treatment With Danazol Before Controlled Ovarian Hyperstimulation in Women With Endometriosis Undergoing IVF

other_outcome.description: number of mature oocyte collected for patient undergoing IVF

overall_official.affiliation: Centre for Endocrinology and Reproductive Medicine, Italy

oversight_info.authority: Italy: National Monitoring Centre for Clinical Trials - Ministry of Health

primary_outcome.description: number of ongoing pregnancy for the number of IVF cycles
